snippet: One shoreline community in New York is the only one so far to embrace an ambitious post-Sandy plan.
abstract: Editorial lauds residents of Oakwood Beach in Staten Island, area devastated by Hurricane Sandy, for taking advantage of New York Gov Andrew Cuomo's ambitious plan to buy waterfront homes, demolish them, and return vulnerable land to nature; expresses skepticism regarding alternate plan by City Councilman James Oddo to rebuild and reinforce such properties.
lead_paragraph: One shoreline community in New York is the only one so far to embrace an ambitious post-Sandy plan.

headline.main: From Flooded Homes to Saltwater Marsh
headline.print_headline: From Flooded Homes to Saltwater Marsh
